page.title: 05KINGSBRIDGE, STEEPLE CLAYDON
page.content: Kingsbridge Farm is approximately 5 miles from Buckingham. It is linked by a footbridge to the village of Steeple Claydon in whose parish it is. The farm covers 191 acres. Corn is grown on 120 acres and the rest is garden and grassland. Most of the latter is used as grazing for a herd of pedigree Hereford cattle. During the Civil War when Charles I was fleeing from Cromwell's army he crossed the brook at a point near the farm- hence the name "Kingsbridge". In about the year 1900 the present farmhouse was converted from a cluster of farm cottages which were previously owned by the Addington Estate, 3 miles to the east. The farm manager lives nearby. The only other dwelling is at Lower Kingsbridge Farm. The farmland has been sold to one of the Oxford Colleges who rent out the fields.
